abstracts.cdata!:
The High Efficiency Lighting Pilot
            Porject is a result of and a contribution to Mexico's
            commitment to environmental protection. The objectives of
            the project are to: a) demonstrate the technical and
            financial feasibility of reducing emissions of green house
            gases and simultaneously reduce local environmental
            contamination through the widespread installation of high
            efficiency lighting; b) build the institutional capacity for
            technological change and energy conservation; c) provide a
            replicable model for demand-side management (DSM) in Mexico
            and elsewhere in the developing world; and d) strengthen the
            Federal Electricity Commission's capacity to practice
            DSM on a sustainable basis. The project will replace
            approximately 1.7 million incandescent bulbs with
            fluorescent light bulbs (FLs) in the cities of Guadalajara
            and Monterrey. The project includes: 1) the acquisition of
            FLs; 2) the purchase of vehicles, metering equipment,
            personal computers, office equipment and sales stands; 3)
            consultant services for canvassing, marketing, testing,
            auditing and project evaluation; 4) the cost of engineering,
            monitoring and evaluation, billing and accounting; and 5)
            the direct costs of implementing the project. The project
            will result in substantial economic benefits including: 1) a
            comparable or higher lighting level at reduced cost; and 2)
            annual energy savings and postponement of costly investment.
